messages.title: Labour delivering for local people
messages.content: Proud to live in the area, helping his community, National Issues with local understanding, Over 6,000 individual cases

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Work alongside local groups like the Friends of Reddish South Station to help local people get the best services and promote community activity.
Guarantee education or training place for young people up to 18; and a job or training place for 18-24 year olds out of work for 6 months, funded by a tax on bankers' bonuses.
Support economic growth, fair tax rises and cuts in lower priority expenditure.
Guarantee tough action on families that create anti-social behaviour.
To halve the deficit in four years.

mentions.candidate: Andrew Gwynne is known for taking up national issues to make those national issues more pertinent and finding a local solution. Handled over 6,000 individual cases on behalf of his constituents.

issues.economy: Support economic growth, fair tax rises and cuts in lower priority expenditure.
issues.education: Guarantee education or training place for young people up to 18; and a job or training place for 18-24 year olds out of work for 6 months, funded by a tax on bankers' bonuses.
issues.socialWelfare: Guarantee tough action on families that create anti-social behaviour.

contactInformation.address: Mr John D Pearson, 230 Manchester Road, Manchester, M34 5QR

endorsements.endorsement: David says the Partnership is 'very satisfied with partnership working & community involvement, knowing Andrew supports fully.'
Kim says 'Without his support, we are really worried we might not reduce A&E demand as we are clearly clear that our fracture clinic and services our community needs would be harder to find.'
Known as 'the voice of Sure Start in Hyde'. Emma values Andrew for his extreme hard work and success in securing money for LOCAL Sure Start centers.
A resident of Audenshaw. Freya is happy that Andrew has helped make sure safe and healthy services for families are still provided.

quotes.text: This election is all about change YOU WANT TO SEE.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The Tories ... a change we can't afford section details some of the Conservative plans deemed unfavorable by the Labour Party, as well as the mention of the Lib Dems attempting to hold the balance of power.
